fields.description:
Hi all,

I am currently working with GreenHopper within JIRA Studio (2.3).
I am working in a software company and we make software engineering and requirements engineering both with JIRA Studio.
We have one single JIRA Project for both kinds of work.
The developers work on the issue types Bug, New Feature, Development Task, Improvement and the requirements engineers work on the issue type Requirement.
Both roles have different workflows.
Now due to the fact that both work on the same JIRA project there are some shortcomings when working with greenhopper.
It is not possible to easily switch between both modes (development and requirements).
Currently we solve the situation the following:
The Greenhopper Template contains all workflow steps (from both disciplines). The developers hide all steps that are for the requirements engineers and the requriements engineers hide all steps that are for the developers.
Further we created two contexts "Development" and "Requirements" that only show the issues types that belong to the users role.
So the problems are the following:
* The hiding of the "not needed" fields must be done manually by each user
* A user that has work to do in both roles (e.g. development lead of the project) has no chance to switch unless he/she adds the hidden fields again.
* It is not possible to provide such settings globally. It must be configured per project per user

What I suggest:
A new setting maybe called "view" that allows the greenhopper admin to define multiple views on workflow basis. I imaging that I can set a template per workflow and in Greenhopper I can then choose what role I have and then I see my templates and my issues. People that have multiple roles can easily switch between those.

I hope you find this meaningful.

Regards,
Florian
fields.summary: Multiple views on a project

fields.description:
Hi,

GreenHopper "User Preferences" setting works on the project basis i.e if I set configuration for one project then its not reflecting in other project configuration. (let say I checked "Background Colour" setting to one of the project then its not reflecting to other projects for me).
Being User setting it seems to be works on user basis for all projects, but its working on user+project basis.

Regards,
- Vishal
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like my User Preferences to be global, not simply project-level user preferences

fields.description:
On JIRA sites with a lot of users (eg. studio.atlassian.com) I find it a pain to search down the 'Assignee' dropdown menu for my own name, or others that are involved in the project.

I'll like to suggest the following menu structure to improve this situation:

| All Assignees
| Unassigned
| _Current User_
| ----
| _Other users with assigned tickets in this project_
| ----
| _Everyone else_

In fact the bottom two sections could be loaded lazily and expanded only when you hover over them.
fields.summary: Improve 'Assignee' dropdown menu in TaskBoard
As a GH user I would like to be able to view the cumulative flow diagram using story points

fields.description: We are using Jira at SAP for Product backlog Management. The biggest pain point is lack of filters in Hierarchy view. Every we need a filter we need to switch to the Ranking View. Also, there is no key word based search. Hence, Once the backlog list is huge then its very difficult to search for a particular backlog item. Can this be improved? What's the main idea of not having filters in Hierarchy view?
fields.summary: No filter options in Hierarchy view and Key word search not availabke

fields.description:
The planning board correctly indents sub-tasks under the parent issues so that it's obvious their relationship. 
This doesn't happen on the task board but it would be great if it did.
fields.summary: Task Board should indent sub-tasks

fields.description: Currently, it's not very apparent when you cannot reorder issues when in planning board, such as when you do not schedule issues permission or when you are viewing the board within a filter.  Suggest recoloring or offering an explanatory message when you attempt to reorder but cannot due to some reason.
fields.summary: Clarify the UX such that more obvious when you cannot reorder issues

fields.description: I would like the ability to predefine a mapping of Story Points to T-Shirt sizes. I enter S,M,L,XL and those values get mapped to pre-defined values. This allows the user to easily enter an easily understood measurement, and the underlying tools to do a calculation based on a statistical entry.
fields.summary: Use a pulldown list for story points (S,M,L,XL) that is then mapped to predefined values

fields.description: If time tracking is enabled these stats show regardless of whether the specific project/sprint is using them or not.
fields.summary: Ability to show/hide time tracking statistics in planning board

fields.description:
Currently when ranking is enabled, if you create a new card on the Planning Board with a card selected, the newly-created card is inserted above the select card. On the Task Board this doesn't occur, however, (it shows at the bottom of the To Do list) and it's not really immediately obvious as to _why_.

A customer raised this as a support issue, and gave a very well thought-out response as to why at least the option to put newly-created cards above the selected card (or at the very top of the list) should exist:

{quote}
The scenario that our Scrum master is interested in is pretty constrained. Being able to add new bugs during a sprint is part of Scrum. Having them added to to top of the sprint backlog is how it's typically done (not just at our company — it's a common practice). I don't think that items need to be inserted directly into either the In Progress or Done columns. I don't think that sorting needs to be supported in the To Do column. Based on the scenario and Scrum practice, the only change needed is the ability to add a Bug to the top of the list (by selecting the top existing item in the list).

Further, Rank, which is a custom field, is kept invisible to the user. All the user is interested in is order of issues — the rank field is a way of supporting a sortable list, and the the specific values that it contains aren't of interest. That is, if four issues are given ranks values or 1, 2, 3, and 4, they will sort in the same order if they are instead given values of 2, 17, 22, and 48. The value doesn't matter.

The task view is showing the same issues as the planning view (for a given version, for example), but divided into three columns based on status. Does the rank value currently remain unchanged when issues are moved across the three columns? Or is it changing to reflect which items are moved across the columns first? (I actually have no idea, but it doesn't look like it's changing to me.)

If the rank value doesn't change when moving across columns (and this is a big "if"), then the rank value will preserve the list order regardless of which column an issue is in. That is, when a new issue is inserted at the top of the to do list, the rank values could be updated behind the scenes exactly as they are when a new issue is inserted at the top of the planning board list. The fact that I can insert a new issue at the top of the planning board list, switch to task board, and see the newly added item at the top of the To Do list suggests that this would be technically possible. That is, it appears that rank applies to all of the issues in a given version and is used to preserve the order. (FWIW, this suggests to me that the answer to your question is that yes, the rank of the cards in the other column should potentially change, but this is invisible to the user as it is done in a way that preserves the order of items in the list. As well, dragging the bug over to the In Progress column should behave the same way it would if it were a previously existing issue, or if it were one newly added in the Planning Board.)
{quote}
fields.summary: Option for new issues created on Task Board's To Do list to be added above selected card

fields.description: GreenHopper users ask for the feature to customize burndown dependency. So far, the burndown is based on the "Done" column of Task Board Column Mapping, which is not so convenient for some scenarios. They want the burndown definition can be independent from Task Board Column Mapping and customizable to base on the specific statuses/resolution.
fields.summary: GreenHopper users want to customize burndown dependency
Issue Navigator search results > Views > Charts errors

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOCSPRINT/Understanding+GreenHopper+charts

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOCSPRINT/Backlog+management+in+GreenHopper

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOCSPRINT/Working+with+Epics+in+GreenHopper (DONE/OBSOLETE)
fields.summary: Migrate DocSprint work to GH space on CAC

fields.description: For instance, 5000d is displayed as "5, 65d" as per the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: CLONE - Incorrect formatting when there is a four digit (or greater) time estimate/remaining/spent

fields.description:
In JIRA, if a field is required there is a 'None' option automatically selected. 
This forces the user to make a selection. This is important UI and often the intention when not setting a default for any field configuration.

I would like the GreenHopper cards to do this too. 


see  JRA-3666
fields.summary: With "new card" use 'None' option if select list is required and has no default

fields.description:
When ranking issues in GreenHopper, the ideal way is to use "Project Overview" mode, where you can drag&drop cards and rank them as you wish. This will include all cards within all "Sprints" across the selected project.

When you are seeing an issue in JIRA, then you select ranking field and edit, it shows only the issues that are in the same "Sprint" (NOT across all sprints, so different than using GH project overview).

IMPROVEMENT: allow users to switch from "Sprint" to "Project Overview" options when editing rank field.
fields.summary: Allow users to switch from "Sprint" to "Project Overview" options when editing rank field

fields.description:
Please add a Total Scope line to the burnup chart in the Chart Board.  This would show the total number of story points (or points of business value) that WERE included in the selected version on each chart date.

The line would often be flat - i.e. a horizontal line at 20 if there are 20 story points (of all statuses) in the sprint.  But the line would go up for days on which scope was added to the sprint.

To me this is the whole point of a burnup chart - if you have increasing scope you can see that you're still making progress but toward a moving target.  A burndown chart shows this as a lack of progress.

The historical scope info required would also be very helpful in calculating velocity and planning new sprints.
fields.summary: Add Scope line to burnup charts

fields.description:
Currently the reindexing mechanism in the GreenHopper ranking field is reindexing all issues which could cause a long waiting period for the user if the project has a big number of issues (in the unscheduled or have at least 1 unreleased version)
The mechanism should be smarter and select just a certain number of issues to be "reflattened" and thus reindexed. This will avoid all issues to be reindexed and greatly ameliorate the waiting experience of the users.
fields.summary: The ranking reindex mechanism should be smarter and avoid reindexing all issues

fields.description: The workflow for my team has multiple stages as it goes through different teams. I would like to be able to track how one team is performing, but the project progress bar only goes green when all the teams have finished on it, that's two weeks too late for me to glean any information. Every iteration every item is "in progress" the whole iteration, which is worthless.
fields.summary: Show other workflow status in Project Progress Gadget

fields.description:
For a better use, I want to be able to set a different ordering attribute and direction for each column of the Taskboard.

E.g. für better use in a daily meeting
- Sort the "Open" column by increasing rank (which issues should be done next)
- Sort the "In Progress" column by "Assignee" (so each one tasks are shown nearby)
- Sort the "Done" column by decreasing "Resolved Date" or decreasing "Updated" (which issues were done yesterday)
fields.summary: As a GH-User I want to sort the taskboard columns in different and independent ways

fields.description:
It would be useful to have the version panel having its position frozen.
Also it would bemore easy to drag a card from bottom into the right version without having to go back to the top of the screen.
fields.summary: Scrooling on card in Planning board should not move the version's panel

fields.description:
We are currently assigning 2 or more components to most of the cards we create, and this operation is impossible on the Agile Tab. Worse, because of a bug on Chrome, this cannot be edited either in Jira view on the Agile tab. 
Could we selectthe components the same way as we do in JIRA 4.2?
fields.summary: It would be great to have the possibility to assign more than one component at cards creation (similar to JIRA 4.2)

fields.description:
IE7, IE8
Click handling issue, cannot stop propagation of event to multi-select.
fields.summary: IE : Middle-click for sub-task link does not work

fields.description: In Planning/Task Board, when a group has a lot of projects, e.g. 30 ones, the project dropdown box will be extended out of browser range, then user has to scroll the whole page to achieve the bottom of project list, it's not so convenient. Customer requires to restrict the length of version dropdown box and show a vertical scroll bar for it (rather than the whole web page) when getting too many versions to be handled by the defined length of dropdown box.
fields.summary: Project Dropdown Box should have a vertical Scroll Bar

fields.description:
Many times my charts aren't accurate as the scrum masters forgot to put a Story "in progress", while the subtasks are moved from the "to do" column. This is mainly caused by the fact that you cannot "move" a task on the board when this task has subtasks. Is there a way to automatically declare "In Progress" a task when one of its subtasks goes "in progress"?
thanks for your help :)
fields.summary: I'd like the tasks to be automatically put "In Progress" when at least one subtask is put "in Progress"

fields.description:
When using drag & drop in card view, I often find it frustrating to determine where cards will end up when I drag one card on top of another one. Sometimes it is positioned before the drop target, sometimes behind it. It does not seem to matter whether I drop onto the left or the right side of the card. It may depend on whether I'm dragging from one row to another or within a row. Trying to drop into the space between cards does nothing at all.

I'd make a few suggestions:

* Drop zones should be consistent. I would recommend dividing the card in two and looking at where the mouse pointer is when dropping. If it's on the left half of the card, drop before. If it's on the right half of the card, drop after.
* The space between cards should be a valid drop zone.
* Rather than highlighting the card that the mouse is over, I would add an indicator to the space between cards where the dropped issue will appear.
* When hovering over an invalid drop zone, change the indicator to show that the card will return to the original location. Maybe change the mouse cursor style to {{no-drop}} as well (see http://www.quirksmode.org/css/cursor.html).
fields.summary: When reordering with drag & drop in card view, it is unclear where the dropped card will be positioned

fields.description: As it is, this has to be assigned manually.
fields.summary: Subtasks should inherit the epic/theme from their parent

fields.description:
We don't always use fix versions with issues (by preference).

When using the agile gadget in 'filter mode' it would be really useful if there was an option for the burndown chart to include all issues returned by the filter (not just those with a fix version). The current behaviour is that issues with an empty fix version get excluded from the burndown. This means that the burndown chart does not give us the full picture of work still remaining as represented by the results of the filter.
fields.summary: Provide option to include issues without a fix version in burndown chart when a filter is specified
As a GreenHopper user I would like an option to reset the remaining estimate to zero upon transition to 'done' (RHS column) on the Rapid Board

fields.description:
In JIRA we use either the auto-complete renderer or the select list renderer for the Affects and Fix Versions fields, both of which allow for multiple versions to be selected. When creating a new card in GreenHopper, the only option is a drop-down list which allows only a single version to be selected.

You can edit it later, but it should be possible to select multiple versions in the first place.
fields.summary: Ability to select multiple versions when creating a new card

fields.description:
(or ordered by the date/time the issue entered the current status)
So you can pick the oldest issue in the queue from the top
fields.summary: As a project manager I would like the order of issues in the task board columns ordered by the time spent in that column

fields.description:
User wants to have the ability to type a URL which brings someone to a GreenHopper Chart. This means specify the project and specific fix version for a GreenHopper Chart (i.e issue/hour burndown)

From support request:
{quote}
I want to have a URL which brings someone to a GreenHopper burndown. I am able to bring some to a particular Project and a particular board type (e.g. chart) but from the URL I don't see how I can specify the "Fix Version" and data selection (Hours Burndown v. Issue Burndown etc.).

So for instance if I give someone this URL it is not in my control which "Fix Version" or data type (Hours v. Issue burndown) they will be looking at

http://jira.xx.com/secure/ChartBoard.jspa?selectedProjectId=10061&selectedBoardId=10180
{quote}
fields.summary: Have the ability to type a URL which brings someone to a GreenHopper Chart

fields.description: I realize that this line is just the sum of burndown and team effort.  Whenever we add an issue to a release cycle, the "Estimate accuracy" line in the ChartBoard also increases.  As a result, the estimate accuracy line really isn't a good indicator when this happens.  Could you add a option to allow users to specify that issues added to release do not affect the "Estimate accuracy" line?
fields.summary: Chart: Improve Estimate Accuracy Line

fields.description: We are using GreenHopper to track 4 month lifecycles of some projects.  Since GreenHopper prints the value of each point on each line in the ChartBoard view, the numbers overlap each other and cannot be read.  Could you please add a feature to only print the value for the last point on each line plotted in the ChartBoard view?
fields.summary: Chart Improvement: Option to Show Value Label on Last Data Point

fields.description: I have just started to use subtasks to create stories.  So I have created a custom subtask of story subtask so that I can easily link to the Epic without have the linking process to cut down on admin time and also to have a clearer indication of the status of the story.  However I have noticed that the subtasks are ignored when it comes to column restraints.  It does say 'Standard Issue Types' however it should really encompase all issue types (including subtasks), or at least have another option for all issue types.
fields.summary: To include subtasks as part of the standard issue count when configuring column restraints

fields.description: Since if the Context of GH Ranking field is set to restrict on the specific Issue Types, Ranking may be disalbed on the projects which issue type scheme includes any issue type not in that Context. So, it's better to display a warning in JIRA side ("Modify Configuration Scheme Context" page) to warn the admin that restricting Context on Issue Type may cause Ranking being disabled in GreenHopper.
fields.summary: Need a warning telling the user GH Ranking field may be disabled if restricting Context on Issue Type
As a user I would like to use keyboard shortcuts to navigate the cards on the taskboard

fields.description:
On the chartboard the burndown chart could be displayed with the remaining hours.
However, for some teams a chart with remaining days is more useful.
fields.summary: As a GH user, I would like to specify if I want the burndown chart in hours or in days

Epics Should Contain Stories In Taskboard Outline View.  It would be much easier to understand and manipulate stories in the outline view if we could see them in the context of an epic, just as we see tasks represented in the context of a story.

fields.description:
Currently when we release directly from the Done column of the task board, there isnt a way to tag the release to a Parent version.

My current workaround is to next every version under a parent, but this doenst really scale, and creates extra work.

Ideally, I would be able to look at a CFD or Burndown for 3 or 4 successive versions at once, and not just one
fields.summary: As a GH / Kanban User I can choose a range of versions when i look at a graph so that my cumulative flow diagrams and burndown charts can contain multiple releases

fields.description:
We are using a version hierarchy of Release and Sprint.
When a user only enters Sprint version in Fix Version field the GH Version Synchronizer service will automatically add parent Release version to Fix Version field. However, when a user enters Sprint version in Affects Version field without Release version there is no synchronizer to auto correct the mistake. This is causing our filters which query for issues by Affects Version to miss issues.

Related post on GH Forum:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257349853&#257349853
fields.summary: As a GH user I can depend on version hierarchy integrity for Affects Version when specify sprint/child version.

fields.description:
as a user of the task board
i'd like to be able to drag/drop the order of tasks within a column
so I can easily set the priority without having to go to the planning board.

I can do this now, by going to the planning board, re-ordering, then going back to the task board, but this seems inefficient
fields.summary: enable issue ordering from the task board

fields.description: This issue will be used to capture all feedback on Spike 2 of GHS-1800.
fields.summary: GHS-1800 Spike 2 Feedback

fields.description:
Task and Planning board cards are not visible when 'Fix Version' field is hidden.

When setting in "Field Configurations" the field 'Fix Version' to "Hide", GreenHopper's Cards simply disappear.

To fix this issue please follow the steps:

   1. Go to Administration Tab
   2. Field Configurations
   3. Select VHL Content/Standard (one at a time)
   4. Scroll down to find "Fix Version" and set it as "SHOW"
   5. Perform a reindex

This is what was causing issues to not be shown in GreenHopper.

I strogly suggest that when user install GreenHopper plugin, it must have the 'Fix Version' field as "Show". Otherwise other customers may experience this strange behaviour that is not that simple to understand, find and fix.

support ticket: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/EHSP-10477
KB article: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Planning+and+Task+board+card%27s+are+not+visible
fields.summary: Task and Planning board cards are not visible when Fix Version field is hidden

fields.description:
From a support ticket, customer requested this improvement:

    * As a tool for engineers, I hope you adjust the labeling to have the right number of significant digits. It's fine to round, but then drop the meaningless ".0" from "4.0". Otherwise actually round to the nearest tenth. This is incredible odd to see in an engineering tool.
    * The average makes a lot of sense as a velocity if averaged over versions (aka sprints) that have been released (aka completed). Your documentation notes that the value chart view is a good way to understand velocity. Averaging over sprints that haven't started yet doesn't make any sense. Can you help me understand why this might be useful, if there is a use?

So please either add the significant amount of digits without rounding or round and remove the ".0". See screenshot for details.
Also clarify second item and add it properly at the documentation.

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Viewing+the+Value+Chart
fields.summary: Add significant digits to "completed" average line in Value Charts

fields.description:
(I admit: that this could be a JIRA base product issue, but starting with Greenhopper since that's where my epic types come from.)

Per http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Setting+Up+Epics+for+your+Project, "An epic is essentially a large user story that can be broken up into several smaller user stories." For this to work, we need an easy way to separate an epic into stories _or_ associating existing stories with epics.

JIRA + Greenhopper does neither well.

Per http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Working+with+Epics, the only way to associate the two is like telling a customer that, for each item he wants to buy, he must put the item down on the front desk, leave the store's front entrance, walk around to the back alley, re-enter through the back entrance, go to the back desk, ask for the item again, and then purchase it. Then he must go back and repeat it all for each additional item he wants to purchase.

How it should be done: If I am viewing an epic or story, provide an easy way to associate that item with an existing story or epic, respectively, without leaving that "viewing an epic or story page." The current process is way too convoluted and gets in the way of me managing my projects.
fields.summary: A project administrator can associate an existing or new story while viewing an epic (or vice versa) without leaving the "view epic (or story)" page

fields.description:
I had to create 20-30 stories in the CONFDEV project today, and it's necessary to set the component field in each to the same value so that the story shows up in my team's backlog.

Unfortunately, the New Story dialog resets the values of all the fields every time you create a new story, so it takes quite a few extra clicks to set it each time.

This is a moderately serious usability problem. If I accidentally missed setting the component on a single issue, that issue wouldn't show up in my backlog. With 50-100 issues already in there, I probably wouldn't even notice until the release had gone out.
fields.summary: New Story dialog should maintain settings for Component, etc. when creating a card
As a GH Scrum template User, I would like to be able to create a story which has a standard set of sub-tasks, modelled to my definition of done
It would be nice to add date fields, like create and update date while editing the card style.

fields.description:
It is very easy to accidentally drop an issue in the wrong place and effectively lose it when dragging and dropping an issue to another page. It would be great to get a confirmation window showing the issue's new location (i.e., surrounding issues) before committing the change.

Alternately, an Undo feature would work.
fields.summary: Add a confirmation window after dragging an issue to another page

fields.description: We'd like to measure performance of the older (currently installed) and new (latest available) version of GreenHopper and we were wondering if there is a testsuite available somewhere that we can use while preparing for the Jira upgrade.
fields.summary: Performance Testing Scripts for GreenHopper

fields.description:
We got custom validator which enforces that business value and size values are in predefined set.
If user enters wrong value that validator shows following message on base JIRA

222 is not allowed. (Allowed values[1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13])

GreenHopper shows following message

Error occurred while creating issue through workflow: : Failed to create Issue

That is very confusing for users since they don't have any way to know what went wrong.
Is there any way to properly show those validator messages on GH? (Since that validator was developed in house we can easily change its code if necessary.)
fields.summary: Custom validator messages are not rendered properly on GreenHopper

fields.description:
Currently its only possible to add statics per project. This request is to allow for a more granular configuration- statistics per version within a project.

Screenshot shows an example of this- Iteration 51 has a different Story Point range than Iteration 52. Also applies to different fields, etc
fields.summary: Allow statics per version in the planning board

fields.description:
Hi, Atlassian has already done a great job for Kanban aficionados. However, IMHO a useful feature is missing: flagging tickets as Ready to be pulled. There may be two ways of achieving this feature:

* By providing a simple flag, similar to "Impediment" (cf. screenshot #1).
* Or by splitting each column in two sub-columns, the second of which representing items ready to be pulled (cf. screenshot #3).

Thanks!
fields.summary: As a GH / Kanban user, I would like to flag a ticket as Ready
As a dashboards user I would like to see the Standard Issue Count in the Statistics Burndown Chart Gadget
As a project manager I would like to see the avatar of the currently assigned user on the card
As a project manager I would like to spread one Kanban WIP limit across multiple subcolumns

fields.description: The Agile Gadget is great, but I need to have the ability to separate the "Info" and "Issues" tabs and the "roadmap" progress bar onto 3 separate gadgets.
fields.summary: Issue burndown chart gadget

fields.description:
I would like to have a pie chart (and bar), that shows the different task board status instead of issue status. I have over 15 different statuses for all of the issue types in a release and there is no way (right now) to show them all in a comprehensive way on a dashboard rolled up. I have found that I can roll up the statuses with the taskboard, however, I can not access that information via the dashboard. It might make sense to implement custom colors (see feature GHS-2514) for the different statuses for when they show up on the pie chart.

taskboard.png shows the 5 statuses I have. 
pie.png shows them in a pie chart.
roadmap.png shows the statuses in a roadmap bar chart.
fields.summary: Custom Task board Statuses reflected in Dashboard Gadgets

fields.description:
Examples of two ways we would use this feature:

1. Display the Unscheduled backlog on one side and the current sprint on the other. 
Currently at sprint planning meetings we have to drag all the stories we want to add out of the backlog and into the sprint. Then we have to open up the sprint and prioritize them there. It would cut our planning time in half if we could drag stories directly from the backlog to the correct priority position in the current sprint.

2. Display the current sprint on one side and the next one on the other.
At the end of the sprint, any stories that were not completed have to be dragged to the next sprint. Then we have to open up the next sprint and reprioritize them. By default, the stories we drag over are added to the bottom of the list. Often the stories we drag over are the highest priority because they are gating issues and must be completed before other stories can be worked on. Again, it would save us a lot of time if we could just drag them to their exact place in the new sprint they need to go.
fields.summary: Ability to view side-by-side backlogs by version on the planning board and drag issues between them

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to limit the WIP for the entire kanban/task board. e.g. I can only have 15 cards total on the board. If 15 are there, then no new cards can enter the workflow.
fields.summary: Enable a fixed WIP limit for the entire task board.

fields.description:
COS:
- Java and REST API
- Document this
- Allow the rank of an issue to be updated
- Write ref app to test

-------------
Uploading new numeric values to the ranking field directly (via SOAP or by manually specifying form arguments) fails.

In JIRA Client, we have a reordering functionality, similar to Greenhopper's, which can be supported by numeric values in a custom field. The user would rearrange issues, JIRA Client calculates numeric values for the order, and then tries to upload them to the server (either via SOAP RPC, or through Edit Issue HTML forms).

This used to work with Greenhopper's Ranking field very nicely. As of version 5.1, 5.2 (probably 5.0 too), it stopped working. If I upload a new Ranking value, it is ignored.

As much as I could gather, you have changed the semantics of the new uploaded value. It used to be exactly the value of the field, as with other normal fields. Now it seems to be exactly the ranking value of another issue, which is desired to follow the one being changed. (Please confirm - is that correct?)

If I may suggest a way to fix this, could you please:
1. Accept any numeric value X for ranking
2. If X matches the ranking value of any issue, act exactly as you do now
3. Otherwise, find the issue that has minimal ranking that is greater than X, and use it as the base issue similar to case 2.

In other words, instead of using "Issue[Rank=X]", use "Issue[min(Rank>=X)]" as the base issue for the change.

That way, the functionality would be more robust and compatible. (I understand the final value may be different from the uploaded one, but I think remote clients can cope with that. Also, you could take the exact uploaded value as a "hint" for the new value of the ranking field.)
 
Thanks!
Igor
fields.summary: As a Plugin Developer I would like to update the Rank of an issue using an API

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Working+with+Epics lists a feature where creating subtasks will automatically populate the greenhopper Epic/Theme field with the Epic Issue Number.

This is a great feature, however its critically limited as it only works when you use the  'Scrum' project template.

We have more than one team. We have more than one greenhopper project template, yet given the above restriction, only one team can have this feature...

By the very nature that greenhopper supports multiple project templates, this feature should be enabled (or at least configurable) on each custom project template as well.
fields.summary: Allow Epic/Theme to be automatically set for custom project templates

fields.description:
We are presently collecting feedback on our spike of multiple project support within GreenHopper. Current information can be found on GHS-1800. 

*This is a _spike_ that was developed with no formal structure or testing. We are trying to get an idea of what GreenHopper will look like with multiple projects. There will be bugs. We will throw all of this code away and we may not ever support multiple projects, there are no guarantees.*

You can create an account on the [customer sandbox|http://greenhopper.onjira.com/] and play around with the functionality. Some points to note are outlines below:

*Current Functionality restrictions*
* Individual projects can no longer be selected.
* The page title and project icon will not reflect the selected project.
* Shared versions will only appear if the all projects selected match the all projects the shared version exists in exactly.
* Within a selection of projects, only the Issue Type Scheme and Permission Scheme can be different.
* Existing versions with the same name will not be linked in Greenhopper, only shared versions created through GreenHopper will be linked.
* Selecting the scrum project template will no longer change the issue type scheme in the selected projects but will still change the other settings.
* 'On the fly' can no longer be selected as a context.

*Tips*
* To choose which projects to select, create a new context or manage/edit an existing one.
* Creating a version in GreenHopper will create a shared version across all of the selected projects.
* Ranking is now global, so changes in rank will affect all contexts. That means that every issue in JIRA has a relative rank to every other issue.
* All schemes, except for issue type and permission schemes, should be the same across all projects that are selected.
* Deleting or releasing versions that are part of a shared version through JIRA (ie, not through the GreenHopper interface) will is strongly discouraged. It will likely not work.
* Configurations selected through Tools>Configuration will now configure based on the selected context instead of project.
fields.summary: Feedback on spike of multiple project support in GreenHopper

fields.description:
When the estimation accuracy chart changes in a burn down it would be great if you could click on that part of the chart to get detailed issue information about what has changed.
Say a user has logged more work than was originally estimated for some issues. It would be great to be able to step to these issues by just clicking on parts of the burn down chart.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to click on a piece of chart line to get the details about what happened with the involved issues.

fields.description:
Hi,

To manage my backlog, I need an extra axis of classification as well as version, assignee and component.

I have added a new field "group" to group related items together.  It would be really useful to be able to switch to a view where I can sort and filter by this field in the same way that I can for versions and components.

Cheers,

Ian
fields.summary: As a project manager I want to manage my Planning Board via a different view mode

fields.description:
We are drowning in tasks, and collecting them into some sort of hierarchy would be one way of managing them. Epics seem like the natural way to create a hierarchy, but they're not visible enough in the planning board.

What I would like is to view a tree hierarchy of my epics which I can expand and collapse - e.g.

[-] Do funky stuff
..[-] Funky feature 1
....[-] funk task
....[-] funk task 2
..[-] Funky feature 2
....[-] funk task A
[-] Do boring stuff
..[-] Boring feature 1
....[-] Boring task
..[-] Boring task 2
..[-] Boring feature 3
....[-] F3 part 1
......[-] Boring stuff
......[-] More boring stuff
....[-] Tedious stuff

I want to be able to expand and collapse the epics so I can control whether I view their sub-tasks.
I want to be able to drag and drop tasks/epics/... onto epics to make them children of the drop target.
I want to be able to rank epics against other epics at the same level of hierarchy.

However, I want to manage epics which span multiple iterations, and are in parallel with other epics which also span multiple iterations...

Not sure how epics should be ranked when sub-issues are ranked interleaved with each other - maybe the parent should be ranked before the first child at all times.  If a child gets dragged earlier, the epic moves with it.

Having the epic tree view to give coarse ranking will speed up the prioritisation process, and being able to collapse epics will speed up bringing new tasks to the top of the priority when there is a long list of tasks.

This reproduces functionality which I would get if I used Rally or VersionOne.

[We're still on 4.3 because we our JIRA has dependencies on Plugins which don't yet support JIRA 4.1, so the sysadmins won't upgrade JIRA, so we can't upgrade Greenhopper, but I can't see anything in the Greenhopper list or documentation which suggests this has been implemented in 5.x]

Cheers,

Ian
fields.summary: As a GH user, I want to work with a tree view of my epics within the planning board

fields.description: At present, as far as I can tell, the y-axis of the CFD shows just number of issues. At least for me, NUMBER of issues is really not a reasonable measure of AMOUNT of work in progress. Ideally all issues would be roughly similar in size, but in practice that is rarely the case. Much more useful would be an axis that showed a variable metric, such as hours or story points.
fields.summary: Cumulative Flow Diagram (CFD) should be able to work in hours as well as number of issues

fields.description:
I want to see all assigned to me issues, in all projects, at agile task board.

Example:

Assigned to me issues -> 
      1 issue in Project 1 
      2 issue in project 2
I want to see in the TaskBoard all the 3 issues. 
I don´t want to select the project.

This is the idea of swimlane in Kanban, because I share team members in this projects, so I use swimlane in Kanbans to control the flow and the WIP, like the image attached.
fields.summary: I want to see all assigned to me issues, in all projects, at agile task board

fields.description:
In current version, when swtiching to a specific Board Mode, GreenHopper automatically applies the Context that is selected by user at the last visit for this Board Mode. However, it's not convenient in some cases, for example the below scenario is from a GreenHopper user, who applies Context as the main refine tool in GreenHopper, and found that sticking to the last Context selection is cumbersome in his workflow, especially after involving Assignee Mode.

{quote}
I am interested in our This iteration context (linked to this iter jira query), Planning board, Project overview to see what everyone is doing.
Then I decide to change from overview to Assignee = John to see what he is doing this iteration.
However the last time I used assignee was on the Planning context so the context switches back to Planning (planning jira query). I did not want this, so I change the Context back to This iteration. 
Put more simply I use Mode to refine the context that I am looking at. When mode changes the context it breaks this work flow.
{quote}

So, it should be helpful to allow user to select the default Context for Board Modes in User Preferences; for example, provide users with the below options:
* Apply the "Default" Context
* Stick on the last Context selection
* Set default Context for each Board Mode manually, ...
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like configure default Context for each Board Modes in User Preferences

fields.description:
Task board improvement provided by Chris Kenny via the blogs: http://blogs.atlassian.com/jira/2010/07/greenhopper-51-agile-planning.html#comment-211855

{panel}
Hi Ken

Are there any plans to introduce the ability to have multiple task
board views. My Epic's have a different workflow to my stories/tasks
and move at a different pace through my lifecycle. I would like to
configure my views so that I can view each task board independently

Thanks
Chris

{panel}
fields.summary: Multiple task board views per project

fields.description: The font size on the planning board for the issues listed is just too small. My eyes hurt! Please increase the font size.
fields.summary: Increase font size when printing cards from the planning board

fields.description: This is a problem because it means I still have to go into the admin menu and edit the version. Or rather, since in the admin menu I can chose the place where to insert the version, this would be the preferred choice, period. This makes the "add version" feature obsolete and means I'm still stuck with the click-orgy in the admin menu.
fields.summary: When adding a verison, the new version will always be added at the end of the version list, isntead of after the currently selected version.

fields.description:
As an administrator,
I want to be able to schedule the burndown chart to be emailed to people,
So that I can keep stakeholders informed of project progress even though they refuse to take the five seconds it would take them to login to Jira.
fields.summary: Scheduled email reports w/JIRA Software charts (Burndown in particular)

fields.description:
in previous version these values were in hours and it was very convenient, as when we came to plan the sprint we calculated the amount of people we have, multiple it with the days of the sprint and multiple it by the time logged every day (that is not JIRA's hours count per day).
This way we got some hours estimation for the sprint - lets say 500 hours.

But now we need to start calculating how many weeks and day these 500 hours stand for. This is really not good.
It should be possible to change the perspective of these values to other units such as hours and days.
fields.summary: GreenHopper planning board - "time estimate / remaining / spent" - it should be possible to see these values in different values - e.g. hours

fields.description: Currently in hour burndown chart we show "trend line" for Burndown, and "ongoing line" for other metrics. The request is to add a switcher in burndown chart to show/hide the "trend line" for team effort / estimate accuracy / required daily burndown rate.
fields.summary: GreenHopper User Requires a Switch in BurnDown Chart to Show The Trend Line for Team Effort / Estimate Accuracy / Required Daily Burndown Rate

fields.description:
At the moment, if you attempt to edit the Default Value of the "Ranking" custom field that GreenHopper uses (from within Administration>Custom Fields>Rank>Configure), you end up with a stack trace in the browser window (see screenshot).

As the Ranking field is used internally by GreenHopper and is managed automatically it shouldn't be edited anyway, but there ought to be a warning of some sort to this effect, rather than the user attempting to edit the field then getting a stack trace.
fields.summary: Need a warning telling the user not to edit the "Ranking" custom field default value

fields.description: As shown in attachment, even when 'Time Aggregation' is enabled in GreenHopper configuration, on Epic/Theme popup window time tracking statistics (Time estimate, Time spent, Time Remaining) of associated issue does not include the time of sub-tasks.
fields.summary: On Epic/Theme Popup Window Time Tracking Statistics of Associated Issue does not Include Sub-tasks

fields.description: More detail can be found [here|http://www.dennisstevens.com/2010/06/07/kanban-and-when-will-this-be-done/].
fields.summary: As a Kanban PO I would like to see a cycle time chart

fields.description: In Planning/Task Board, when a project has the many versions, e.g. 30 ones, the version dropdown box will be extended out of browser range, then user has to scroll the whole page to achieve the bottom of version list, it's not so convenient. Customer requires to restrict the length of version dropdown box and show a vertical scroll bar for it (rather than the whole web page) when getting too many versions to be handled by the defined length of dropdown box.
fields.summary: Version Dropdown Box should have a vertical Scroll Bar
Ability to filter by Epics quickly (show all epics like stories with roll up details)
Comprehensive Charts

fields.description:
Is some departments we use the flagging feature to emphasise urgent which cannot wait to be prioritized  before next planning meeting. Together with context, this gives the unplanned/planned issues velocity as well. 

But then we need to use other ways to track impeded tasks (status or priority field). But I like the way the flagging field highlights the issue on Planning Board and Task Board. 

Of course, everything of this can be solved, but it is not very neat and intuitive. I don't like to use the status for impediment, becuse it is not really a workflow status (You would need to be able to reach impeded from all status etc.). Priority is a bit lost after GH introduction, since ranking is the real priority. Priority has kinda become severity, even though you cannot change the name.

Would you consider to improve the it feature to support multiple values, maybe even combined with multiple colored flag marker?
fields.summary: As a reporter, I would like to be able to flag an issue with multiple types of flag

fields.description: The customer requires to get the exact reason that prevents the transitioning in Task Board; for example, when using the default workflow shipped with JIRA, there's a condition on "Start Progress" transition - _"Only the assignee of the issue can execute this transition."_, and when user makes the the transition from "TO DO" column to "IN PROGRESS" column, they may get the error message _"Sorry, no transitions were found! Are you meeting all the workflow step conditions? If so you might want to verify your Task Board mapping."_, but it's a little hard for them to understand the true reason except they're administrator to check workflow. They want to see the specific reason in that popup, e.g. "you should be assignee of this task to make this transitioning".
fields.summary: Improve the error message on the TB transition by providing information on what condition/validator/step is preventing the transition of a card

fields.description:
We have a few columns matched up to our workflow. a simplified form is as follows (the happy path of the workflow)

Review Queue -> In Review -> Development Queue -> In Development -> Testing Queue -> In Testing -> Closed

Only items in the "Review Queue" count as "TODO" and everything up to Closed counts as "Done" even though "Development Queue" and "Testing Queue" are not "IN PROGRESS".

It would be nice to configure each queue to map it to their "work in progress" type of status.
fields.summary: Taskboard Mappings to "TODO", "IN PROGRESS" and "DONE"

fields.description: Customers are seeking the ability to have max/min notifications based on the sub-task count, in addition to the standard issue count.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like my column constraints on the TB to provide a sub-task count

fields.description:
JIRA 4.x really improved our experience by reducing the set of JIRA projects to the list of JIRA projects that a particular user regularly accesses. Unfortunately, GreenHopper stills lists *all* projects (or all projects that have GreenHopper enabled, but since we want GreenHopper enabled for all projects, it is the same thing).

This was problematic in GreenHopper 4.4.1 and before, but GreenHopper 5.0 seems to make this problem worse as instead of the pulldown presenting a scrollable list, it now presents a menu which stretches across multiple screens and requires the user to scroll the entire browser window down to see later projects in the list, which is non-intuitive for a user interface.

If GreenHopper were to list the same projects that JIRA does "projects that I have recently accessed", this would be really great.

In some regards, I also wonder why the duplication in functionality is necessary. Since the JIRA "Projects" pulldown already allows project selection, do we really need a second GreenHopper based project selector right underneath? Is it required to dis-ambiguate navigation - user wants to see project page vs GreenHopper planning board for project?
fields.summary: As a user of a JIRA instance with many projects, I want JIRA 4.x style project selection available in the GreenHopper project selector.

fields.description:
We are using smartboards together with the agile plugin to provide our customers with a simulation 
of a physical scrumboard: 

* The task board is projected on the smartboard. 
* The intention is that users drag tasks from the 'todo' column to the 'in progress' column during the scrum.

The fact is that users have been changing state of individual tasks during the previous day,
and it is therefore more difficult for them to remind what they have been doing.
(especially on a monday).  

It might be handy to be able to flag the tasks that have been modified in some way, so that
during the scrum one can say 'and what happened to this one' ...

Highlighting works partially cause you can 'dim' the issues that didn't change recently, but then
it also dims the containing stories 


Filtering out the non changed issues is not a solution neither cause they must be available to
discuss during the scrum ...
fields.summary: As a user, I can easily identify the issues that have been modified yesterday, to report on it during the scrum

fields.description:
If you are the user that created the context OR a user that is using a bad context, you can change it by:

    * go to chartboard
    * select an empty version (this was the only way i found to change the version that you look at in the taskboard, without getting a stack trace), delivery cycle 14 in this project.
    * after the chart loads, go to the taskboard
    * this will bring up the taskboard, but you will not get a stack trace because there are no tasks
    * change the context to a good context, or delete if you are the create user.

Can this be a feature request that a jira administrator is able to delete contexts in greenhopper via some admin screen OR can the application catch the exception and show an empty task board with 'bad context' message to the user?
fields.summary: Delete Contexts via Admin Screen

fields.description: The epic system is new and most welcome, but like most new features there are many things that could be done to improve it; one is not having to remember the epic's key when link a story to an epic.  There are multiple ways of achieving this including; (pop up list, auto-complete ala linking, drag and drop)
fields.summary: As a GH user I can associate a Story with an Epic without having to have remembered the issuekey of the Epic, to avoid mistakes and make Epic linking easier

fields.description:
We have observed that with Greenhopper installed (and presumably when it is enabled for a given project) that subtasks which are created without specifying a fix version (namely, from within the standard Jira 4.0.x interface options) will inherit *every* fixVersion from their parent, even versions which have been archived.

This allows the content of the archived versions to be changed after they have been archived and interferes with the integrity of historical data.

So, given the following hierarchical version relationship within Greenhopper...
{noformat}
Release Goal
|-- Release Backlog
`-- Release Commitment
    `-- Sprint
        `-- Sprint Plan (Archived)
{noformat}

...we may have a number of issues and subtasks which were Archived as part of the "Sprint Plan" version (to provide a baseline for future comparison). Additional Sprint work takes place in the "Sprint" version. If additional subtasks for one of the planned issues are created either within a Greenhopper version board focusing on the Sprint version or from within a Jira screen explicitly specifying the "Sprint" fix version, then the subtask is created as desired, with the "Release Goal", "Release Commitment" and "Sprint" versions, but without the archived "Sprint Plan" version. 

In fact, because the "Sprint Plan" version has been archived, it cannot be assigned to a new subtask through conventional means. 

However, if the subtask is created through the Jira interface and a version is not assigned at creation time, every fixVersion from the parent is duplicated in the subtask. The workaround for a subtask in this condition is laborious as it involves unarchiving the version, editing the subtask to remove the version which the listener added in error and rearchiving the version.

Note that all that is necessary for this to take place is to have Greenhopper installed on the system. It will occur even if the project is not associated with Greenhopper and if all of the configurable listeners are disabled. I conclude from this that the process which is setting these versions is a core listener associated with Greenhopper.
fields.summary: Archived versions should not be included when fix versions are propagated (via listener?) to new subtasks
Epics should use parent-child-grandchild structure as opposed to utilising a label
Implement the upgrade task

On the GreenHopper Task Board, I need the ability to select "All" Fix Versions for a selected Context. My Context filter includes issues from multiple fix versions, which I need to view together on a single Task Board.
Add validations on the "create" and "edit" events
Add the mechanism to remove the templates
Add the mechanism to store new templates

fields.description: As per this [forum post|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257333226] and comments from Luc during a customer interview.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to see the Summary of the Epic issue within the header of the Epic dialogue.
As a GH administrator I would like the ability to add a custom template
Upgrade the project tab to the agile gadget
